questions.question: How did the Dred Scot decision affect the rights of black Americans?

choices.answer: Slaves could be free if they moved north
Congress had the right to decide where slavery was legal

questions.question: What were Jim Crow Laws? (check all that apply)

choices.answer: Laws that segregated blacks and whites
Laws that gave blacks equality with whites in the south
Protected whites when they committed violence against blacks

questions.question: How did literacy tests/poll taxes violate the rights of black Americans? (check all that apply)

choices.answer: Allowed whites to use violence against blacks
Prevented blacks from finding better jobs in the south
Restricted blacks right to vote with unfair tests or taxes

questions.question: What led to the Great Migration of black Americans in the U.S.? (check all that apply)

choices.answer: Violence against blacks from the KKK
Laws that kept them from voting and segregated
Freedom and opportunity led most blacks to go to Africa
Jobs in the north that were available because of WWI

questions.question: What difficulties did black Americans face after migrating north?

choices.answer: Were discriminated against in work, school and housing
Sent back to the south because they weren't allowed north
Faced little resistance integrating into white neighborhoods
Happy to be out of the south and didn't face difficulties

questions.question: Which of the following individuals directly challenged segregated transportation? (check all)
During the Montgomery Bus Boycott, what other types of transportation were used? (check all)
Which legal action overturns the constitutionality of Plessy V Ferguson?

choices.answer: Heart of Atlanta Motel v United States

questions.question: The SNCC was developed by what group to coordinate activities, marches and protests?
What was the goal of the "Greensboro Four"?

choices.answer: Develop a new form of civil disobedience

questions.question: How did blacks use labor strikes as a strategy to fight for Civil Rights?

choices.answer: Blacks protested against Jim Crow laws and refused to work
Blacks used to fight against wage discrimination
Blacks did not use strikes as a strategy

questions.question: Which of the following Civil RIghts leaders was assassinated?
What caused the race riots in Los Angeles in 1992?
Which represents the beliefs of the SNCC and Black Panther organizations?

choices.answer: SNCC were any means necessary/Panthers were peaceful
SNCC and Black Panthers were any means necessary
SNCC were peaceful/Black Panther were by any means necessary
SNCC and Black Panthers were both peaceful
